strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Arena Rules</color>

<color=#FFD145>About Points</color>
You can choose any opponent and attempt to challenge them.
<color=#FF423F>Your points will increase</color> if you win, and <color=#FF423F>decrease</color> if you lose.
More points will be added after the battle ends, based on the difference in points between you and your opponent.
When you reach the point limit for your current rank, you will <color=#FF423F>rank up</color>.

<color=#FFD145>About Ranks</color>
There are a total of seven ranks in Arena:
<color=#FF423F>God of Thieves</color>, <color=#FF423F>Trickster</color>, <color=#FF423F>Chivalrous Phantom</color>, <color=#FF423F>Notorious Rebel</color>, <color=#FF423F>Professional Thief</color>, <color=#FF423F>Beginner Thief</color>, and <color=#FF423F>Thief's Apprentice</color>. Below 
<color=#FF423F>Notorious Rebel</color>, <color=#FF423F>Professional Thief</color>, <color=#FF423F>Beginner Thief</color>, and <color=#FF423F>Thief's Apprentice</color>, there are three sub-ranks. 
After reaching the <color=#FF423F>Chivalrous Phantom</color> rank, your rank will no longer increase after reaching a certain amount of points; instead, it will increase based on your total accumulated points.
You will need to place in the top 1% of the rankings to reach the <color=#FF423F>God of Thieves</color> rank.
You will need to place in the top 5% of the rankings to reach the <color=#FF423F>Trickster</color> rank.

<color=#FFD145>About Rewards</color>
When you first reach a new rank, you can obtain <color=#FF423F>achievement rewards</color> once.
The first time you rank up into each rank during a season, you can obtain <color=#FF423F>season rank rewards</color>.
These rewards will reset at the end of every season.
Unclaimed rewards will be sent to your in-game mailbox.
Based on your rank when a season ends, you can obtain <color=#FF423F>season total rewards</color>.
These rewards will be sent to your in-game mailbox after calculation has completed.
Every hour, you can obtain a portion of your <color=#FF423F>total rewards</color>, based on your current rank.
Total rewards have a limit of 10,000 and must be obtained manually.
When you win a challenge, you can obtain <color=#FF423F>victory rewards</color>.

<color=#FF423F>About Opponents</color>
You can select three opponents, as well as refresh your selection.
Once you reset, you will not be able to refresh for another 5 minutes.
Title: About the Arena

Title: About Phantom Idol Contracts

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Draw Rates</color>
5★ Item: 0.6%%, 4★ Item: 6.2%%, 3★ Item: 93.2%%

<color=#FFD145>Guarantees</color>
After 10 continuous draws, an item of 4★ or higher is guaranteed to appear.
After 80 continuous draws, a 5★ item is sure to appear.

<color=#FFD145>Total Rates with Guarantee</color>
5★ Item: 1.70%%, 4★ Item: 13.88%%, 3★ Item: 84.42%%

<color=#FFD145>Most Wanted Events</color>
When obtaining a 5★ item, there is a 50%% chance it will be your Most Wanted 5★ item.
If the 5★ item wasn't a Most Wanted 5★ item, the next 5★ item will be a Most Wanted item.
When obtaining a 4★ item, there is a 50%% chance it will be your Most Wanted 4★ item.
If the 4★ item wasn't a Most Wanted 4★ item, the next 4★ item will be a Most Wanted item.

<color=#FFD145>Event 5★ Items</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Recommended 4★ Items</color>
Phantom Thieves: %s, %s.

<color=#FFD145>Non-Recommended 5★ Items</color>
Equal Drop Rates.
Phantom Thieves: %s.

<color=#FFD145>Non-Recommended 4★ Items</color>
Equal Drop Rates.
Phantom Thieves: %s.
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Obtainable 3★ Items</color>
Equal Drop Rates.
Personas: %s.
Title: About Most Wanted Phantom Idol Contracts

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Home</color>

<color=#FFD145>Home Points</color>
As your degree of comfort increases, your Home level will also rise.
You can obtain Home Points through the following methods:
1. When you obtain a piece of furniture for the first time.
2. When a friend visits your Home for the first time each day.
The daily limit for Home Points is <color=#FF423F>500</color>. The limit for Home Points earned through friend visits is <color=#FF423F>20</color>.

<color=#FFD145>Home Level</color>
There are 10 Home levels, and you can earn rewards as your level increases.
Level-up rewards include unlocking Home features, increasing the number of display items, and new Home themes.
You can check the details of level-up rewards from the top-right corner of the Home screen.
Title: About Home

strContent:
<size=32><color=#FFD145>About Phantom Thief Status</size></color>
HP and SP do not restore on their own in Mementos. Use items or status effects to restore them.

<color=#FFD145><size=32>Reset Time</size></color>
Mementos resets every Sunday at <color=#FF423F>8 PM UTC</color>.
The interior of Mementos, the Shadows that appear, and events change every week.
<size=32><color=#FFD145>About Rewards</size></color>
Earn Mementos rewards by successfully clearing stages.
Title: About Mementos

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Phantom Pass</color>
You can obtain rewards by completing missions.
Daily goals reset every day at 8 PM UTC, while weekly goals reset every Sunday at 8 PM UTC.
Unobtained rewards will be distributed via the Mail screen.

<color=#FFD145>Phantom Pass Rewards</color>
Phantom Pass rewards will be available with each Phantom Pass season.
Purchasing a <color=#FF423F>Premium Phantom Pass</color> or <color=#FF423F>Premium+ Phantom Pass</color> will grant even more valuable rewards.

<color=#FFD145>About Limitations</color>
There is a limit to the amount of Pass Experience Credits that can be obtained each week.
Experience earned through Season missions will not count toward this weekly limit.

<color=#FFD145>Weekly Supplies</color>
Every week, you can receive <color=#FF423F>Supply Sets</color> from the Phantom Pass screen.
Your Supply Pack reward rank for the following week will increase based on how many daily goal rewards you complete during the current week.
Title: About the Phantom Pass

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Premium Pass</color>
This unlocks the Phantom Pass <color=#FF423F>Premium</color> Lane.
It also grants Meta Jewels immediately upon purchase.

<color=#FFD145>Premium Pass+</color>
This unlocks the <color=#FF423F>Premium</color> Lane and all accompanying rewards.
It also raises your Phantom Pass level by <color=#FF423F>10 levels</color> immediately on purchase, and grants premium-exclusive rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Exchanging Weapons</color>
When you purchase the <color=#FF423F>Phantom Pass Premium</color>, you can obtain Salamander Coins x5.
Salamander Coins can be traded for <color=#FF423F>5★ weapons</color> at the Airsoft Shop in Shibuya.
Title: Phantom Pass Benefits

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain materials to level up the Phantom Thieves.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: Realm of Repression: Pursuit of Honor

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain materials to level up weapons.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: Realm of Repression: Pursuit of Parts

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can earn tons of Konpaku Gems.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: Realm of Repression: Pursuit of Treasure

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain Persona enhancement materials.
Consuming multiple times the stamina will allow you to receive multiple times the rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: Realm of Repression: Pursuit of Persona

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain random Revelation Cards.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive rewards multiple times at once.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.

<color=#FFD145>Set Drop Details</color>
Words of Life: Love and Opulence.
Words of Bonds: Prosperity and Truth.
Words of Feuds: Courage and Valor.
Words of Ruling: Power and Victory.
Words of Nature: Control and Renewal.
Words of Serenity: Peace and Hindrance.
Title: Realm of Repression: Revelation Set

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain Talent materials for the Phantom Thieves.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: Realm of Repression: Alluring Aroma

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain weapon overclock materials.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: Realm of Repression: Gear Forging

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain materials used to level up the Phantom Thieves.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: Realm of Repression: Enlightenment

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain Personas, Persona Seals, and Repression Medals.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
You can trade Repression Medals for Persona Seals in the Exchange Shop.
Title: Realm of Repression: Persona

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
By completing challenges and consuming stamina, you can obtain Mindscape enhancement materials.
Consuming more stamina will allow you to receive more rewards.
The amount of rewards also increases in high-difficulty trials.
Title: DC[St][116]

strContent: About the Collection
Title: Metaverse Seals

strContent:
By <color=#FFD145>training the Phantom Thieves</color>, you can increase
their stats.
Additionally, you can equip them with weapons and Revelation Cards, and enhance their skills.
Title: Phantom Thief

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Leveling Up Phantom Thieves</color>
When Phantom Thieves level up, their stats increase.
After reaching a certain level, their Personas can unlock skills.
A Phantom Thief's max level is limited based on the protagonist's level.
Leveling up Phantom Thieves requires experience items like Thief Compendium Scraps, Thief Compendium Volumes, and Thief Compendium Tomes.
Experience items can be obtained from Pursuit of Honor.

<color=#FFD145>Talents</color>
To surpass the current maximum level, a Talent must be enhanced. Whenever a Talent is enhanced, you will obtain either new skills, or level up skills you already have. Phantom Thief stats will also be enhanced at the same time.
Enhancing Talents requires enhancement items such as Whiff of Iris or Fragrance of Iris. Talent enhancement items can be obtained from Realm of Repression: Alluring Aroma.

<color=#FFD145>Awareness</color>
A Phantom Thief's awareness level indicates the degree of evolution of their Persona, which can be enhanced up to level 6.
Increasing a Phantom Thief's awareness level raises talent effects and greatly increases their prowess in battle.
Increasing an awareness level requires a Phantom Thief's Cognitite.
When you acquire a Phantom Thief that you have already obtained, they will automatically be converted into Cognitite for that Phantom Thief.
Title: About Training

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Weapons</color>
Each Phantom Thief has certain weapon types they can use.
The higher the rarity and base ability of the weapon, the stronger it can become.

<color=#FFD145>Enhancement</color>
When a weapon is enhanced, its base ability is increased.
The enhancement level cannot exceed the current overclock level of the weapon.
Weapon enhancement level will be inherited when replacing weapons.
Enhancement items include metal parts, silver parts, and gold parts.
You can obtain these from clearing Realm of Repression: Pursuit of Parts.
Weapons that you no longer need can be used as enhancement materials.

<color=#FFD145>Overclock</color>
When overclocked, a weapon's base ability can be greatly enhanced.
Weapon overclocking corresponds to Phantom Thief level.
Overclock level is transferred between equipped weapons.
Overclocking requires weapon overclock items.
Overclock items consist of Blue Crystals, Purple Crystals, and Yellow Crystals.
Overclock items can be obtained from Realm of Repression: Gear Forging.

<color=#FFD145>Forging</color>
You can forge a weapon to strengthen its effects.
Forge levels 1, 3, and 5 require weapons of the same name, while 2, 4, and 6 require weapons of the same star level.

<color=#FFD145>Scrapping Weapons</color>
4★ weapons can be scrapped for 2 Gecko Coins if they aren't forged.
Forged 4★ weapons will grant extra Gecko Coins based on their forge level.
Note: 5★ weapons that can be forged with shards, like Sennight Inferno, cannot be scrapped.
Title: About Weapons

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Revelation Cards</color>
You can increase a Phantom Thief's strength in battle by equipping them with Revelation Cards.
There are 5 Revelation Card marks: Space, Sun, Moon, Star, and Sky.

<color=#FFD145>Set Effects</color>
Heavens: Includes Sun, Moon, Star, and Sky. Equipping 2 or 4 Revelation Cards of the same set will activate the 2-piece set or 4-piece set effect, respectively.
Space: There are multiple set effects for the Space Revelation effect, which is determined by the effects of the Heavens 4-piece set that is currently active.
You can determine the effect of the required 4-piece set from the name of the Space set effect.

<color=#FFD145>Revelation Card Enhancement</color>
When you enhance a Revelation Card, the Revelation's base power increases.
If there are fewer than 4 attributes, 1 attribute will be added.
If there are 4 attributes, existing attributes will be randomly enhanced.
Revelation Card Enhancement is not limited by character level, but Space Revelation Cards will not unlock until Wonder reaches level 40.

<color=#FFD145>Obtaining Revelation Cards</color>
Sun, Moon, Star. and Sky Revelation Cards can be obtained from each Revelation Card Dungeon in the Realm of Repression.
The higher level the challenge, the higher probability of obtaining high-rarity Revelation Cards.
Title: About Revelations

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Skill Details</color>
Skills are used through Personas.
Usable skills include skills, Talent skills, awareness skills, 1 Mores, Highlights, melee attacks, and ranged attacks.
Awareness skills can be strengthened by raising a Phantom Thief's awareness level.
Talent skills can strengthened by raising a Phantom Thief's Talent.
Additional skill effects have special conditions for activation in battle.
You can increase a skill's level up to 15.

<color=#FFD145>Skills</color>
Personas have unique active skills which have skill effects that can be increased by enhancing that skill.
Leveling up a skill requires skill enhancement materials and special drop materials from Shadows.
Skill enhancement materials can be obtained in the Realm of Repression: Enlightenment.

<color=#FFD145>Affinities</color>
You can view a Persona's Attribute Affinities from the Skill screen.
Affinities will be displayed as: Wk = Weak, Dr = Drain, Str = Resist, Rpl = Repel, and Nul = Null.
Weak: Increases damage dealt by 20%.
Drain: Nullifies attack and target absorbs 20% of damage to heal.
Resist: Reduces damage dealt by 50%.
Repel: Nullifies attack and reflects 20% of the damage back at attacker.
Null: Nullifies attack and deals no damage.
Title: About Skills

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Schema</color>
When a Persona is recorded in the Persona Compendium, you earn schema points.
Schema points can be used to level up schema skills.

<color=#FFD145>Resetting Your Schema</color>
You can reset your schema by spending Konpaku Gems.
When reset, the spent schema points are refunded.
Title: About Schema

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Acquiring Personas</color>
You can obtain Personas by defeating Shadows in Palaces.
If you obtain a Persona you already own, it will automatically be converted into a Seal of that Persona.
Using Persona Seals, you can fuse rarer Personas.

<color=#FFD145>Persona Effects</color>
When you equip a Persona, you can use its skills during battle.
The protagonist can summon up to three Personas at the same time.

<color=#FFD145>About Personas</color>
Persona Fusion: Fuse Personas to create new ones.
Persona Training: Strengthen, develop, and enhance skills of your Personas.
View/Summon Personas: Check detailed information about your Personas.
Title: Persona

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Enhancement Level</color>
Raising the Enhancement Level through Persona Enhancement increases the Persona's HP, Attack, and Defense.
At certain levels, skills will be unlocked.

<color=#FFD145>Enhancement Materials</color>
Enhancement items include Memory Cubes, Anecdote Cubes, and Legend Cubes. These can be obtained in the Realm of Repression stage Pursuit of Persona. Persona Seals can also be used as enhancement materials.

<color=#FFD145>Overclocking Personas</color>
Overclocking a Persona allows you to further increase the Persona's level and enhance its traits.
A Persona Seal or Treasure Demon Item is required for overclocking.
The number of overclocks a Persona can perform is determined by its rank.

<color=#FFD145>Persona Rank Up</color>
When Jánošík reaches a certain level, you can use specific items to increase its rank. Ranking up grants even greater power.
Title: Persona Enhancement

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Training</color>
By training, your Persona can awaken new skills.
Training materials require Persona Seals. Using different seals allows you to teach different skills.
The skills granted are determined by the skills that are the source of the Seals.

<color=#FFD145>Skill Acquisition</color>
Using one Persona Seal allows you to randomly acquire one of the Seal skills.
If you acquire a skill that has already been learned, you will receive a set number of Repression Medals II instead.
Depending on the attributes of the Persona, some special attribute skills cannot be learned.
Title: Persona Training

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Skills</color>
Each Persona can equip two Unique Skills and up to six Learned Skills.
Unique Skills cannot be removed, but Learned Skills can be changed freely.
The number of Learned Skills that can be equipped varies depending on the Persona's Rank.

<color=#FFD145>Unlocking Skills</color>
When a Persona reaches a certain level, it can unlock new exclusive skills.

<color=#FFD145>Changing Skills</color>
You can equip and remove skills that the Persona has learned.
The maximum number of skills that can be learned is 20. Once this limit is reached, you cannot learn new skills from Training. By Forgetting a skill, you can learn new skills again.
You can equip up to two Active Skills.
There is no limit to the number of Passive Skills that can be equipped.

<color=#FFD145>About Traits</color>
All Personas have one trait, which can be enhanced through Overclock.
Title: Persona Skills

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Function Description</color>
You can check the detailed information of all Personas in the Persona Compendium.
You can view specific acquisition methods, profiles, tags, growth parameters, and more.
Tap on How to Get to move to the location.

<color=#FFD145>Persona Record</color>
When you acquire a Persona, it will be recorded in the Persona Compendium.
Once a Persona is recorded, you will earn schema points.
Title: Persona Compendium

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Feature Explanation</color>
Unlock safe rooms, explore hidden locations on the map, solve puzzles and acquire Treasures, and Defeat Unique Shadows.
These actions will increase the exploration level of the Palace.

<color=#FFD145>Exploration Rewards</color>
When the exploration level reaches a certain threshold, you can receive rewards.
At 50% exploration, you will receive a special 5★ weapon as a reward.
Title: Palace Progress

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
To fish, you need to buy an entry ticket. The fishing points you earn can be exchanged for rewards at the shop.
The rarer and larger the fish, the higher the price you can sell it for.
Top-tier fish can be used for cooking.

<color=#FFD145>About Bait</color>
Different types of bait attract different types of fish.
If fish aren't biting, try changing the bait.

<color=#FFD145>Hit</color>
When a fish bites, it enters a Hit state.
The durability of the fishing rod is displayed at the top of the screen.
Keep the float within the red range and press the reel-in button to pull the fish closer.
Pressing the reel-in button outside the red range will cause the fish to move away.
If the float touches the ends of the durability gauge, the durability will decrease.
If the durability reaches 0, the fish will get away.
Title: About Fishing

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Unlocking Plans</color>
Lufel's "Business" Plans I and II have seven steps each.
You can unlock the next step by completing a certain number of missions.

<color=#FFD145>Mission Rewards</color>
After you complete a mission, you can receive its rewards.
You can also receive special rewards once you complete a certain number of missions.
If you complete all of the missions in Plan I, you can obtain one 5★ Phantom Thief of your choosing.
If you complete all of the missions in Plan II, you can obtain one 5★ weapon of your choosing.
Title: About Lufel's "Business" Plan

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Synergy</color>
Each accomplice has a Synergy level, which can be increased up to a maximum rank of 20 (10 for Lufel).
To rank up, you need to meet certain conditions such as social stats, Persona skills, or clearing certain missions. Synergy also increases when you hang out with or give gifts to an accomplice.
Special outings that advance your relationship will unlock the Synergy rank cap.
* If these conditions are not met, Synergy outings will not be available.

<color=#FFD145>Prioritized Bonds</color>
Prioritizing a bond will greatly increase the chances of an outing event with that character.
* If the conditions are not met, the outing event will not occur.

<color=#FFD145>Relationships with accomplices</color>
When your Synergy with an accomplice reaches a certain level, your bond with them will deepen, and you can become <color=#FF423F>close friends</color>.
With some accomplices, you can form a special bond and become <color=#FF423F>soulmates</color>.
Rank rewards are linked to your relationship with the accomplice. Star-marked rewards are for close friends, and heart-marked rewards are for soulmates.
If both close friend and soulmate rewards are available at the same rank, you will receive one based on your relationship with the accomplice.

<color=#FFD145>Synergy Abilities</color>
Synergy abilities are obtained by increasing your Synergy with accomplices.
Each accomplice has their own abilities, which can be unlocked and enhanced as your Synergy rank increases.

<color=#FFD145>Profiles</color>
You can check the basic information, voice lines, and story of an accomplice from the Profile screen.
Title: About Synergy

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>City Life</color>
You are free to choose how you spend your time in the city.
You can earn money by working part-time, hone your abilities, or enjoy time with your accomplices.

<color=#FFD145>Actions Left</color>
You can perform events twice after school, twice in the evening, and once at night.
Time will progress after event completion.

<color=#FFD145>Action Points</color>
Performing 1 City Life event consumes 1 Action Point.
Action Points recover by 5 points every day at 8 PM UTC.

<color=#FFD145>City Life Rewards</color>
City Life activities can reward social stat increases, money, Synergy gifts, and more.
Some events can enhance base rewards from City Life.
City Life Planned Rewards will show the obtainable rewards after the increase.
Title: About City Life

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Feature Explanation</color>
You can adjust the formation by selecting an empty slot or a Phantom Thief set in the party. Only the position of support Phantom Thieves can be changed.

<color=#FFD145>Changing Your Party</color>
You can view your parties by pressing the Party button on the top right of the screen to view the party list. You can change a party's name by pressing the Change Name button. Names can be up to 7 characters long.
Select a party and press Set to change to the selected party.

<color=#FFD145>Assist Phantom Thief</color>
In the Realm of Repression and some exploration challenges, you can use Assist Phantom Thieves.
An Assist Phantom Thief cannot exceed your current Phantom Thief level limit.
In Gates of the Nightmare Catcher, you can use Phantom Thieves belonging to Companio members regardless of level limit.
When another player uses your Assist Phantom Thief, or when you use an assist Phantom Thief from another player, you will obtain Assist Points.
You can use Assist Points to purchase items through Exchange: Assist Rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Flames of Desire</color>
When Phantom Thieves of the same attribute are set in the same party, a harmonious effect called Flames of Desire is ignited.
This effect only applies to the Personas of the protagonist and the three set Phantom Thieves, not support Phantom Thieves.
When two party members have the same attribute, a Duet of that attribute is activated.
When three or more party members have the same attribute, a Chorus of that attribute is activated.
When the party has four or more of different attributes, a Concerto is activated.
Title: Party Formation

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Reading</color>
You can read the books you own.
Reading a book consumes 1 action point.
You cannot read a book again once you have finished it.

<color=#FFD145>Reading Rewards</color>
Reading significantly increases your social stats, and reading certain books can unlock outing spots.
Title: About Reading

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Watching Movies</color>
New movie releases are regularly shown at the cinema.
Watching a movie consumes 1 City Life Point and you will need to pay for your ticket, but it will significantly increase your social stats.

<color=#FFD145>Screening Period</color>
Each movie has a screening period. You will receive an extra boost to your social stats the first time you watch each movie.
The screening period of movies is based on in-game time. If there's a movie you want to see, plan your activities accordingly.
Title: About Watching Movies

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Introduction</color>
This is the Persona 5 special event.
It features several events that are now underway, including Thieves' Alliance, Converging Destinies, Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc, Good Steals, Thieves' Exchange, and Café Leblanc.

<color=#FFD145>Event Schedule</color>
The Take Your Heart event begins from the day the player creates an account.
After 30 days, it will switch to a regular event.
Players can continue to take on unfinished events.
When it switches to a regular event, the Thieves' Exchange and Café Leblanc events will end.
Unused Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems, so make sure to exchange them for your desired items.

<color=#FFD145>Thieves' Alliance</color>
When you participate in the event for the first time, you'll receive rewards.
When the protagonist reaches certain levels, you can obtain additional rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Converging Destinies</color>
Log in for a total of 7 days during the event period to receive special rewards every day.

<color=#FFD145>Good Steals</color>

Most Wanted Phantom Idol Contracts for the Phantom Thieves of Hearts are now available. Check the Contracts screen for more details.

<color=#FFD145>Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc</color>
Infiltrate dungeons with the Phantom Thieves of Hearts!

<color=#FFD145>Thieves' Exchange</color>
Trade Rebel Coins obtained in the event for rewards here!

<color=#FFD145>Café Leblanc</color>
Meet the Phantom Thieves of Hearts at a café in Yongen-Jaya.
Complete event missions to receive grand rewards.
Title: About the Take Your Heart event

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Draw Rates</color>
5★ Item: 0.8%%, 4★ Item: 8%%, 3★ Item: 91.2%%

<color=#FFD145>Guarantees</color>
After 10 continuous draws, an item of 4★ or higher is guaranteed to appear.
After 78 continuous draws, a 5★ item is sure to appear.

<color=#FFD145>Total Rates with Guarantee</color>
5★ Item: 1.95%%, 4★ Item: 14.86%%, 3★ Item: 83.19%%

<color=#FFD145>Most Wanted Events</color>
When obtaining a 5★ item, there is a 40%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 5★ item.
If the 5★ item wasn't a Most Wanted 5★ item, the next 5★ item will be a Most Wanted item.
When obtaining a 4★ item, there is a 50%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 4★ item. If the 4★ item wasn't a Most Wanted 4★ item, the next 4★ item will be a Most Wanted item.

<color=#FFD145>Event 5★ Items</color>
%s(Select 1 from the 3 listed). 

<color=#FFD145>Most Wanted 4★ Items</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Non-Most Wanted 5★ Items</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Non-Most Wanted 4★ Items</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Obtainable 3★ Items</color>
%s.
Title: About Most Wanted Arms Deals

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Graphics Settings</color>
Configure various graphical settings.

<color=#FFD145>Sound Settings</color>
Adjust individual volume settings.

<color=#FFD145>Game Settings</color>
Customize individual in-game system settings.

<color=#FFD145>Control Settings</color>
Adjust your game controls.

You can view details on <color=#FF423F>each setting</color> by tapping the ? icon.
Title: About Game Settings

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Security Level</color>
The level of security awareness is displayed as the Security Level meter. When the Security Level is high, enemy security becomes stricter.

<color=#FFD145>Changes in Security Level</color>
If you are spotted by enemies, the Security Level of the Palace will increase.
If you defeat enemies without being detected, the Security Level of the Palace will decrease.
Title: About Security Level

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Realm of Repression</color>
In the Realm of Repression, you can obtain large amounts of materials vital to training.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Description</color>
As your power grows, new challenges will be unlocked.
Challenges consume stamina, but you can earn valuable rewards upon completion.
Stamina will automatically recover over time, and you can also use items or Meta Jewels to restore stamina.
Title: Realm of Repression

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Draw Rates</color>
5★ Item: 0.7%%, 4★ Item: 8%%, 3★ Item: 91.3%%.

<color=#FFD145>Guarantees</color>
After 10 draws, an item of 4★ or higher is guaranteed to appear.
After 70 continuous draws, a 5★ item is sure to appear.

<color=#FFD145>Total Rates with Guarantee</color>
5★ Item: 1.95%%, 4★ Item: 14.86%%, 3★ Item: 83.19%%.

<color=#FFD145>Most Wanted Event</color>
Before drawing Arms Deals, you will select two weapons of your choice.
If a 5★ item appears, there is a 50%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 5★ item.
If the 5★ item wasn't a Most Wanted 5★ item, the next 5★ item is guaranteed to be a Most Wanted item.
If a Most Wanted 5★ item didn't appear, you will obtain one of the two selected weapons at random (50/50 odds for either weapon).
If a 4★ item appears, there is a 50%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 4★ item.
If the 4★ item wasn't a Most Wanted 4★ item, the next 4★ item is guaranteed to be a Most Wanted item.

<color=#FFD145>Event 5★ Item</color>
Phoenix Dagger.

<color=#FFD145>Most Wanted 4★ Items</color>
Devastating Bounty, Grand Presser, Machete.

<color=#FFD145>Your Pick 5★ Items</color>
Revenge Axe, Golden Legacy, Quasar, Fallen Angel Wing, Karmic Cycle, Venus Sunrise, Divine Spirit of Fire, Shadowkiller, Cyberdeck.HACK(), Rosethorn, Nuclear Finisher, Queen of Winter, Battle Hymn.

<color=#FFD145>Non-Most Wanted 4★ Items</color>
Judgment, Swinging Hammer, Lava Flame, Omega Knuckle, Sword of Honor, Blue Saber, Jagato, Ghost Machine C, Masquerade Ribbon, Sacred Vow, Gilgamesh Axe, Shamshir

<color=#FFD145>Obtainable 3★ Items</color>
Gang Star, God Saber, Lightning Hammer, Break Tonfa, Slashing Flail, Swinging Hammer, Elegant Rapier, Sacred Saber, Seishiki Sword, Intrusion Detection Rig, Spike Whip, Flash Punch, Royal Saber, Bardiche, Athame.
Title: About Most Wanted Arms Deals

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Persona Fusion</color>
You can fuse Personas from the list using Persona Seals.
If you fuse a Persona you already own, you will receive one seal of that Persona.

<color=#FFD145>Required Seals for Fusion</color>
You must use the specified seals in Persona Fusion.
There may be multiple ways to fuse the same Persona.

<color=#FFD145>Unlocking Fusion</color>
When the protagonist reaches a certain level, higher level Personas can be unlocked for fusion.

<color=#FFD145>Skill Inheritance</color>
When fusing a new Persona for the first time, the skills inherited will vary depending on the source Personas.
Title: Persona Fusion

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Gardening</color>
In the garden, you can cultivate flowers and cooking ingredients.
The garden is divided into left and right sections, with small planters for flowers and large planters for ingredients.
Flowers can be made into gifts at the workbench.
Ingredients can be used for cooking.

<color=#FFD145>Gardening Actions</color>
There are two kinds of actions: fertilizing and removing.
Each plant can be fertilized only once.
If you remove a plant, you will not receive any bonuses.

<color=#FFD145>Harvesting</color>
You can harvest when the plants are ready.
By consuming 5 City Life Points, you can advance the game time by one day.
When you harvest a plant for the first time, you will receive an additional increase to <color=#e6b625>Kindness</color>.
Title: About Gardening

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Recipes</color>
By learning recipes, you will be able to cook new dishes.


<color=#FFD145>Cooking</color>
You can cook dishes using ingredients, which can be obtained from shops or by gardening.
When you cook, there is a chance that you will a make a superb version of that dish.
As you continue to cook recipes, your cooking proficiency will go up.
Even after reaching the Master Chef level of proficiency, you have a chance to receive new recipes if you continue cooking dishes.


<color=#FFD145>Cooking Buffs</color>
If you eat/drink a dish while exploring the Metaverse, you will gain a temporary buff.
Eating/drinking superb dishes grants even stronger buffs.
Title: About Cooking

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Creating a Companio</color>
You can create your own Companio. 20,000 Konpaku Gems are required to make a Companio.
Names already in use by other Companios cannot be used.
When you create a Companio, you become the leader and can recruit new members.

<color=#FFD145>Joining a Companio</color>
Players can join an existing Companio.
Some Companios require the leader/subleader's permission to join.
Leaving a Companio will trigger a 24-hour cooldown period.

<color=#FFD145>About Contribution</color>
You can gain Contribution by participating in City Life or Metaverse activities.
You can check each member's degree of Contribution from the Companio's member list.

<color=#FFD145>Companio Roles</color>
▼Leaders Can:
• Edit Companio notices
• Edit the Companio's name
• Edit the Companio's avatar
• Edit the Companio's description
• Change join settings (messages, requirements, and autojoin level)
• Manage join requests (allow/deny)
• Manage members (view, promote, and kick)
• Leave the Companio

▼Subleaders Can:
• Edit the Companio's avatar
• Manage join requests (allow/deny)
• Manage members (view/kick)
• Leave the Companio

▼Members Can:
• View members
• Leave the Companio
Title: About Companio

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Train Tickets</color>
You can collect train tickets in the following ways:
1. Open <color=#FF423F>Chained Treasure Chests</color>
2. Defeat <color=#FF423F>Angry Shadows</color>
3. Pick up items scattered around Mementos

<color=#FFD145>Fare Machines</color>
By redeeming tickets at fare machines, you can gain experience and raise your ticket level.
Reaching certain levels will grant rewards and allow you to continue your progress in Mementos.
There are various routes in the Metaverse, and leveling up requires different types of tickets.
Title: About the Fare Machine

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
The batting cages offer both Training Mode and Challenge Mode.

<color=#FFD145>Training Mode</color>
Select difficulty and practice your swing.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Mode</color>
Limited to 5 balls, aim for the highest possible score.
You can exchange points you earn for presents and fashion items.
Title: About Batting Cages

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Shadow Hunting Grounds</color>
Continue Palace exploration and encounter concealed Personas.
Chance to obtain rare Personas upon victory.
Title: Shadow Hunting Grounds

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
During infiltration, you can earn points by picking up Gold Coins.
The faster you clear the challenge, the higher your score.

<color=#FFD145>Evaluation Rewards</color>
As your points and multiplier increase, your final evaluation will be higher.
The higher the evaluation, the more valuable the rewards.
Title: Strange Castle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Recollections</color>
Explore previously cleared Palaces (Exploration progress will continue from before the Palace's collapse).
Title: Chamber of Recollections

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Assist Phantom Thief</color>
You can designate one teammate as an Assist.
After a friend uses the Assist Phantom Thief, you will earn Assist Points.

<color=#FFD145>Assist Points</color>
You can earn up to 50 assist points daily.
Once the limit is reached, no more points will be accumulated.
You need to press the receive button to collect the points you have earned.
Assist Points can be exchanged for items.
Title: Assist Recovery

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Switching Outfits</color>
In City Life, you can switch between two types of outfits.
Around the city: Casualwear
At home: Loungewear

<color=#FFD145>How to Change Outfits</color>
Open the closet in your bedroom to swap between the two types of outfits.
You can save your favorite combinations as Presets for easier switching.
Title: About the Closet

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Drop Rates</color>
5★ Character: 0.6%%
4★ Character: 6.2%%
3★ Character: 93.2%%

<color=#FFD145>Guarantees</color>
After every 10 pulls, a character of 4★ or higher is guaranteed to appear. After every 80 pulls, a 5★ character is guaranteed to appear.

<color=#FFD145>Total Probability with Guarantee</color>
5★ Item: 1.70%%
4★ Item: 13.88%%
3★ Item: 84.42%%


<color=#FFD145>Most Wanted Event</color>
If a 5★ character appears, there is a 50%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 5★ character.
If the 5★ character was not a Most Wanted 5★ character, the next 5★ character is guaranteed to be a Most Wanted character.
If a 4★ character appears, there is a 50%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 4★ character.
If the 4★ character was not a Most Wanted 4★ character, the next 4★ character is guaranteed to be a Most Wanted 4★ character.

<color=#FFD145>Rate-Up 5★ Characters</color>
Phantom Thieves: %s

<color=#FFD145>Rate-Up 4★ Characters</color>
Phantom Thieves: %s

<color=#FFD145>Regular 5★ Characters</color>
Equal Drop Rates.
Phantom Thieves: %s

<color=#FFD145>Regular 4★ Characters</color>
Equal Drop Rates.
Phantom Thieves: %s

<color=#FFD145>Regular 3★ Characters</color>
Equal Drop Rates.
Personas: %s
*<color=#FF423F>Characters include Thieves and Personas</color>.
Title: About Most Wanted Contracts

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Draw Rates</color>
5★ Weapon: 0.8%%
4★ Weapon: 8%%
3★ Weapon: 91.2%%.

<color=#FFD145>Guarantees</color>
Every 10 Arms Deals, a weapon of 4★ or higher is guaranteed to appear.
Every 78 Arms Deals, a 5★ is guaranteed to appear.

<color=#FFD145>Total Probability with Guarantee</color>
5★ Weapon: 1.95%%
4★ Weapon: 14.86%%
3★ Weapon: 83.19%%

<color=#FFD145>Most Wanted Event</color>
If a 5★ weapon appears, there is a 40%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 5★ weapon.
If the 5★ weapon was not a Most Wanted 5★ weapon, the next 5★ weapon is guaranteed to be a Most Wanted weapon.
If a 4★ weapon appears, there is a 50%% chance it will be a Most Wanted 4★ weapon.
If the 4★ weapon was not a Most Wanted 4★ weapon, the next 4★ weapon is guaranteed to be a Most Wanted weapon.

<color=#FFD145>Rate-Up 5★ Weapons</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Rate-Up 4★ Weapons</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Regular 5★ Weapons</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Regular 4★ Weapons</color>
%s.

<color=#FFD145>Regular 3★ Weapons</color>
%s.
Title: About Most Wanted Arms Deals

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Fortune-Telling</color>
When you get a fortune reading from Chihaya Mifune, your luck increases and you gain various effects.
To get a reading, you need to spend money and 1 City Life Point.

<color=#FFD145>Bonus</color>
The Bonus is only calculated when the player receives additional rewards.
Actions unrelated to the fortune reading will not consume the bonus.
There is no time limit on the duration of the bonus.
If you get another fortune reading, the effects of the previous reading will be overwritten.
Title: About Today's Fortune-Telling

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Catch Log</color>
All of the fish you have caught will be recorded in the catch log.
When the amount of fish recorded in the log reaches a certain amount, you can obtain collection rewards.

<color=#FFD145>About Unlocking</color>
Caught fish will be unlocked in the catch log.
You can catch small fish at the beginner pond, medium-sized fish at the expert pond, and large fish at the master pond.
Title: About the Catch Log

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
In Relativity's Labyrinth, you can earn points by picking up Gold Coins.
The fewer traps you activate, the more points you can earn.

<color=#FFD145>Evaluation Rewards</color>
As your points and multiplier increase, your final evaluation will be higher.
The higher the evaluation, the better the rewards.
Title: Relativity's Labyrinth

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Briefing</color>
Defeating Unique Shadows grants you special abilities for the final battle.
Defeat the final boss of the castle to clear the stage.

<color=#FFD145>Earning points</color>
Damage dealt in the final battle is calculated as Damage Points.
The more allies survive, the more points you earn.

<color=#FFD145>Evaluation Rewards</color>
As your points and multipliers increase, your final evaluation improves.
The higher the evaluation, the better the rewards.
Title: Well-Used Dungeon

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>The Velvet Trials</color>
Defeat Unique Shadows with special abilities to hone your battle prowess and aim for higher battle ratings.

<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
The Velvet Trials are high-difficulty challenges. There are multiple stages, each divided into several areas. Completing Trial Stage 5 will unlock all stages.
You can freely change your formation before the battle starts. If you find the battle too difficult, you can reset it at any time.
Each battle has three ranks. At the end of the battle, your rank will be determined based on the points you earned.


<color=#FFD145>Earning Points</color>
Damage dealt during the battle is calculated as points.

<color=#FFD145>Special Point Conditions</color>
By meeting special conditions, you can earn additional points.
You can challenge the stages multiple times to aim for the highest score.

<color=#FFD145>Double Party Challenge</color>
Some Velvet Trials will require you to command a Double Party to take on the challenge.
The same Phantom Thieves and Personas cannot be used in both parties.
Points from both battles will be tallied after the second battle is completed.
Title: The Velvet Trials

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
The Trials from the Sea of Souls are high-difficulty challenges held for a limited time, with four stages released each season.
You must clear the stages in order, and there are a total of nine trials up to Stage 3.
In the final stage, and you must endure attacks from powerful foes for a specified number of turns.
Once a stage begins, you cannot change your party until you clear it. The party's state will carry over to the next trial.
If you find the challenge too difficult, you can reset the trial at any time.

<color=#FFD145>Special Effects</color>
When you challenge the Trials from the Sea of Souls, certain stages may have Special Effects. Be sure to check the effect description and change the Phantom Thieves in your party to suit the situation.

<color=#FFD145>Points</color>
Each trial up to Stage 3 has Stage Goals. You can obtain points each time you complete stage goals.
In the final stage, the damage dealt to enemies will be converted into points.
You can challenge the stages multiple times to aim for the highest score.

<color=#FFD145>Rank</color>
If the Phantom Thieves meet the conditions for increasing their rank during the trial.
As rank increases, the trials will become more challenging, but the rewards you can earn will also become more substantial.

<color=#FFD145>Trial Rewards</color>
When you clear a trial, you will receive special rewards.
Mission Rewards: Each season bring new challenge missions.
Completing these missions will earn you rewards.
Ranking Rewards: At the end of the season, Merope will send ranking rewards based on the Phantom Thieves' ranking.
Rank Rewards: When you reach a new rank for the first time, you will receive rank rewards.
When you clear the trial objectives, you will receive Star Crystals corresponding to your level.
Collect a certain amount of Star Crystals to receive valuable rewards.
Title: Trials from the Sea of Souls

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Recollections</color>
By completing challenges, you can obtain rare materials to enhance your Personas.

<color=#FFD145>About Rewards</color>
You can receive rewards up to twice a week.
Each Shadow in Recollections can yield rewards once per week.
The reward count for Recollections resets every Sunday at 8 PM UTC.
Title: Recollections

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
Clear the objectives to earn rewards.
The event ends when all objectives are completed.
Title: Start Rewards

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
Merope has prepared a series of trials for the Phantom Thieves in the Velvet Room.
Fight against Personas to hone your skills and clear these trials.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
During the event, you can obtain 4★ Phantom Thieves and weapons when you clear trials.
Obtain the 4★ Support Phantom Thief Kayo Tomiyama by clearing Technician stage 1 in the Velvet Trials.
Obtain the 4★ Phantom Thief Tomoko Noge by clearing Technician stage 6 in the Velvet Trials.
Obtain the 4★ weapon Shadow Crown by clearing the Eastern Construction Site in Trials from the Sea of Souls.
Title: Trials of the Deep

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
After the event starts, you can receive daily rewards in Converging Destinies.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
Rewards can be obtained based on the total number of login days.
Rewards reset daily at 8 PM UTC.
Title: Converging Destinies

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Memories</color>
By using Cognitive Shards, you can unlock chapters in Memories.
Unlocked chapters can be viewed repeatedly.

<color=#FFD145>Memories Rewards</color>
By viewing each of the Memories until the end, you can obtain Watch Rewards.
Title: A Thief's Memories

strContent: Error: tnxotb-[StrUIPlayRule_strContent_170]
Title: Start Rewards

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
You need money to get capsules from capsule machines.
Rewards obtained from capsule machines are registered to your capsule collection.
You can earn even more rewards by completing a capsule series.
You can trade your unwanted capsules with friends
or recycle them to get Surprise Capsules.

<color=#FFD145>Capsule Probability Explanation</color>
Draw Rates for 8-Piece Sets
Super Rare Capsule Rate: 1.25%
Rare Capsule Rate: 12.5%
Common Capsule Rate: 86.25%
Draw Rates for 6-Piece Sets
Super Rare Capsule Rate: 1.25%
Rare Capsule Rate: 6.25%
Common Capsule Rate: 92.5%
You can double the draw rates of rare and super rare capsules by reading "Encapsulated Mysteries."

<color=#FFD145>How to Use</color>
Select a capsule machine that sells the series you want to obtain and draw a capsule from that capsule machine.
Title: About Capsule Machines

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Collection Level</color>
The protagonist's activities are recorded on the Collection screen.
When a new item is recorded, you will earn collection points.
As you get more collection points, your collection level rises, and you can earn rewards.
Title: Collections

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
Each season, open Gates of the Nightmare Catcher to challenge a number of bosses at multiple difficulty levels, which must be cleared in order. The number of bosses that appear will be random.
Gates of the Nightmare Catcher can be taken on an unlimited number of times.
The bosses that appear and scores achieved will be reset every season.

<color=#FFD145>Extermination Points</color>
Damage dealt to bosses becomes extermination points.
You can increase the number of points you obtain by taking on higher difficulties.
Only the highest point value will be recorded.
Earning points allows you to obtain point rewards and further raise your Companio's total points.
Your Companio's total points will affect your Companio's rank in Gates of the Nightmare Catcher.

<color=#FFD145>Party Locking</color>
When you take on a boss, the Phantom Thieves, Personas, and Revelations you've used will be locked.
Locked Phantom Thieves, Personas, and Revelations cannot participate or be used in other Gates of the Nightmare Catcher challenges.
If you wish to edit your party, you must reset the challenge.
This will reset your obtained points, but won't affect your total points or any unlocked difficulty levels.

<color=#FFD145>Rewards</color>
Stage Rewards: You will receive stage rewards upon reaching certain personal extermination point milestones.
These points are reset at the end of each season.

<color=#FFD145>Participation Rewards</color>
You will gain more rewards according to the number of Companio members taking on Gates of the Nightmare Catcher.
Participation Rewards are also reset at the end of each season.

<color=#FFD145>Rank Rewards</color>
At the end of the season, ranking rewards will be sent corresponding to your Companio's rank.
Ranking Rewards are reset every season.
Title: Gates of the Nightmare Catcher

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Information</color>
Using the Selfie Machine allows you to temporarily transform into someone else.

<color=#FFD145>How to Use</color>
Select the person you want to become from the Companio's Selfie Machine and save to transform.
Title: About the Selfie Machine

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Clubs</color>
After school and in the evening, you are free to participate in club activities.
You can practice with the soccer club members or join the band for performances.

<color=#FFD145>Club Level Up</color>
By completing club mini-games or participating in the club's City Life activities, you can earn club experience points.
Once you accumulate a certain amount of experience points, your club level will increase.
As your club level increases, new club missions will appear, and new stages will be unlocked.

<color=#FFD145>Self-Practice</color>
Self-practice does not consume City Life Points.
Title: About Clubs

strContent: Error: tnxotb-[StrUIPlayRule_strContent_177]
Title: NB[St][177]

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>How to Play</color>
Participate in the soccer club's penalty kick practice. Choose the direction of the shot and press the Shoot button to take the shot.

<color=#FFD145>Club Level</color>
You can earn experience points by completing the soccer club's activities or clearing each difficulty level for the first time.
As the club level increases, higher difficulty stages will be unlocked, and your insight will increase.
Title: About the Soccer Club

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Controls</color>
You can change the shooting direction with the control stick or WASD keys.
Hold the shoot key and release it in the red area to perform a powerful shot.


<color=#FFD145>Tips for Success</color>
Each goalkeeper has a <color=#FF423F>weakness</color>, so observe their movements carefully.
When your insight reaches a certain level, you can identify the goalkeeper's weakness. Targeting the weakness and triggering <color=#FF423F>WEAK</color> will guarantee a goal.
Title: About the Soccer Mini-Game

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>How to Play</color>
You can join the music club as a bass player.
When you start playing, notes will descend from the top of the screen.
Press the notes in time with the line to earn points.
Yellow notes require a single press, while green notes need to be held down.

<color=#FFD145>Platforms</color>
Easy, Hard, and Pro difficulties can be played with smartphones, PC, and gamepads.

<color=#FFD145>Points</color>
There are four ratings based on timing accuracy:
Perfect, Great, Good, and Miss.
Playing in time will continue your combo.
The longer the combo, the higher the score for each note.
Getting a Miss will break your combo.

<color=#FFD145>Fever Mode</color>
As you continue playing, you will enter Fever Mode.
During Fever Mode, your score will increase significantly.
Fever mode will continue as long as your combo is not broken.

<color=#FFD145>Adding New Songs</color>
You can unlock new songs by raising your club level.
To unlock the next difficulty,
you need to achieve an A rating on the current difficulty.
Title: About the Band

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Puzzle Bots</color>
Win the challenge by moving the<color=#FF423F>King Bot</color> to the exit within the movement limit.

<color=#FFD145>Brawl Bots</color>
There are three difficulty levels for the challenge: Easy, Normal, and Hard.
Clearing a higher difficulty stagewill automatically clear all of the lower difficulties for that stage.
You can obtain robots and Combat Chips from the star rating rewards of Puzzle Bots.

<color=#FFD145>Comments</color>
During the show, comments from the audience will come in.
Clearing Puzzle Bots Chess and Brawl Botswill unlock comments.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>You can earn rewards by completing and clearing challenge goals.
Clearing Easy, Normal, and Hard difficulties in Brawl Bots will also earn you rewards.
You can also obtain rewards when you view the latest comments.

<color=#FFD145>Official Merchandise Shop</color>
TV Show Points earned in the event can be exchanged for items in the Official Merchandise Shop.
Title: Robotic Challenge Event Explanation

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Trading Basics</color>
You can trade capsules up to three times every day.
Each capsule can only be traded <color=#FF423F>once</color>.
You can trade with friends recorded in your address book.
If you have <color=#FF423F>at least two</color> of the same capsule, you can trade for a capsule of the <color=#FF423F>same rarity</color>.
There are limits to trading for capsules from different series.

<color=#FFD145>Trade Requests</color>
You need to set at least one capsule for a request.
The set capsule will be taken from your inventory, but you can cancel at any time and the capsule will be returned to you.
The capsule will then be displayed on the market and shown to your friends.

<color=#FFD145>Trading</color>
When there's a capsule on the market that you want, you can exchange it with a capsule you have designated for exchange.
The capsule will be delivered to the person you are exchanging with via the <color=#FF423F>Mail</color> screen.
Title: About Capsule Exchange

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc is the first part of the Persona 5 special event.

<color=#FFD145>Castle Exploration</color>
During the event period, you can unlock a new stage when you clear the previous stage.
Earn rewards for first-time completion of stages.

<color=#FFD145>Reward</color>
By completing mission goals before the event ends, you can earn mission rewards and Rebel Coins.
Rebel Coins can be exchanged for exclusive rewards at the Thieves' Exchange.
After the event ends, unused Rebel Coins will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
The badge rewards in Exploration Goals will not be exchanged after the event ends.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event period, you can earn target rewards by completing the specified missions.

<color=#FFD145>Schedule Refresh</color>
During the event period, you can interact with the Phantom Thieves of Hearts at Café Leblanc every day, both after school and at night.
*Ann Takamaki will appear in City Life after clearing stages 1-6 of The Crossroads of Fate: Castle Arc.
Title: Café Leblanc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
You can get Cattlepower by completing certain missions during the event.
You can then explore the Metaverse and spend a certain amount of Cattlepower to get rewards.
Unclaimed rewards will be sent to your in-game mailbox.

<color=#FFD145>Event Missions</color>
Daily missions are reset every day at 8 PM UTC during the event.
Title: Send 'Em Flying

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Return Conditions</color>
1. The protagonist is at or above level 15 and has cleared up to Traces of Dreams: Return to Shibuya in the main quest.
2. You haven't logged in for 7 or more consecutive days, and the return login reward letter is active.
3. You haven't logged in for 14 or more consecutive days, and the return login reward letter or return event Returner Rewards is active. 
4. 30 days or more have passed since your last return login reward letter was active.
Title: Return Conditions

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the Welcome Back Bonus event period, missions will be unlocked every day.
You can obtain rewards by completing these missions while the event is ongoing.
If you complete a certain amount of missions, you can obtain even more rewards.
Title: Welcome Back Program

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the Welcome Back Bonus period, you can obtain event login rewards every day.
Title: Seven Days of Secret Gifts

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the Welcome Back Bonus event period, you can obtain even more rewards from Realm of Repression: Training Materials.
These increased rewards can be claimed up to 5 times a day and up to 35 times in total while the event is ongoing.
Title: Training Support

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event period, you can earn Cat Food by completing each Daily Mission in Can Replenishment.
By selecting Treasure Hunt, you can offer a specified number of Cat Food cans to have the Orange Tabby search for hidden treasures.
The Treasure List shows all the treasures hidden by the Orange Tabby.
Collecting the Orange Tabby's favorite trinkets, Wish Beads, allows you to start the event mission Paw it Forward.<color=#FFD145>Mission Refresh Rules</color>During the event period, Daily Missions will refresh at 8 PM UTC every day.
Title: Tabby's Treasure

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
You will receive random puzzle pieces when you clear Daily Missions during the event period.
Progress rewards will be granted according to the amount of obtained puzzle pieces.
Completing a puzzle will grant special rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Mission Refresh Rules</color>
During the event period, Daily Missions will refresh at 8 PM UTC every day.

<color=#FFD145>Puzzle Piece Rules</color>
You can confirm obtained puzzle pieces by tapping the Game Launch Button.
After obtaining all of the puzzle pieces, any additional pieces you acquire will be converted into a small amount of Konpaku Gems.
Title: Puzzle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
You can select capsules from the list and recycle them.
Only duplicate capsules can be recycled, and at least one of each series will remain in your bag.

<color=#FFD145>Recycle Rewards</color>
Figures have different priority levels depending on the series.
Capsules from the same series have the same priority level regardless of rarity.
When you recycle a capsule, you will receive a Surprise Capsule S. If you recycle 30 or more, you will receive a Surprise Capsule L.
Opening a Surprise Capsule S will randomly grant you random <color=#FF423F>vegetable seeds or cooking ingredients</color>.
Opening a Surprise Capsule L will grant you a random <color=#FF423F>Synergy gift</color>.
Title: About Recycling

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
During the event, clearing Training Materials dungeons in the Realm of Repression, such as Pursuit of Honor, Pursuit of Parts, Pursuit of Persona, or Pursuit of Treasure, will grant you extra rewards for basic materials (experienced not included).
If there are random rewards included in the basic material rewards, you will receive results of 2 random draws.
If the protagonist has reached the maximum level, experience points obtained in dungeons will be converted to Konpaku Gems. Converted Konpaku Gems will not be eligible for extra rewards.
Title: About Enhancement Rush

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
During the event, clearing Training Materials dungeons in the Realm of Repression, such as Alluring Aroma, Gear Forging, or Enlightenment, will grant you extra rewards for basic materials (experienced not included).
If there are random rewards included in the basic material rewards, you will receive results of 2 random draws.
If the protagonist has reached the maximum level, experience points obtained in dungeons will be converted to Konpaku Gems. Converted Konpaku Gems will not be eligible for extra rewards.
Title: About Awakening Avenue

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
During the event, clearing a Persona dungeon will grant you extra rewards for basic materials (experienced not included).
If there are random rewards included in the basic material rewards, you will receive results of 2 random draws.
If the protagonist has reached the maximum level, experience points obtained in dungeons will be converted to Konpaku Gems. Converted Konpaku Gems will not be eligible for extra rewards.
Title: About Shadow Hunt

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
During the event, clearing a Revelation Set dungeon will grant you extra rewards for basic materials (experienced not included.
If there are random rewards included in the basic material rewards, you will receive results of 2 random draws.
If the protagonist has reached the maximum level, experience points obtained in dungeons will be converted to Konpaku Gems. Converted Konpaku Gems will not be eligible for extra rewards.
Title: About Astounding Revelations

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
In Character Trials, you can try out the Phantom Thieves in the specified stages.
In the stages, only the preset team can be used, meaning the team composition and Phantom Thieves' training cannot be adjusted.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
After clearing the specified stages for the first time, you can receive rewards on the event screen.
Title: Character Trial

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, you can use Route Tickets to play the Spin the Win Raffle.
There are two ways to earn Route Tickets: complete Marthym's Limited-Time Offers or play the Metro of Desire during the event.

<color=#FFD145>Prize Pool</color>
The raffle machine contains six prize pools, the first five of which contain a grand prize.
Each prize pool has more valuable rewards than the previous one.
You can select any pool to enter the raffle.
If there are still rewards left in a prize pool after the event ends, your remaining route tickets will be used automatically to enter the raffle, and prizes from those spins will be sent to your Mailbox.
Title: Spin to Win Raffle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Feature Unlock</color>
Metro of Desire: Dream Line has been unlocked.
You can participate once the protagonist has reached level 32, and the tutorial mission for Metro of Desire has been cleared.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event period, you can obtain Route Tickets by participating in the Metro of Desire.
Route tickets can be used to participate in the Spin to Win Raffle.
Title: Metro of Desire

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
There are six sub-events included in the event: Museum Arc, Bank Arc, Relativity's Labyrinth, Sinners of Vanity and Gluttony, Action Report, and Gallery Auction.

<color=#FFD145>Event Duration</color>
Part 2 of Crossroads of Fate: Museum and Bank Arcs limited event.
On the last day, all events will close with the exception of the Museum Arc and Bank Arc, and all unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Be sure to exchange them for rewards as soon as possible.
At the conclusion of the event, the Museum Arc and Bank Arc will change become permanent events, and you will be able to continue exploring these stages.

<color=#FFD145>Museum and Bank</color>
Fight alongside Phantom Thieves of Hearts once again.

<color=#FFD145>Sinners of Vanity and Gluttony</color>
Challenge powerful bosses and gain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Relativity's Labyrinth</color>
Solve the mysteries of the maze, unravel mechanisms, and earn rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Action Report</color>
Complete event goals and gain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Gallery Auction</color>
Use Destiny Badges obtained through action reports to trade for rewards in the collection gallery.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Part 2

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
The museum and bank arcs of Crossroads of Fate are the second part of the special event with Persona 5.

<color=#FFD145>Palace Exploration</color>
During the event period, new stages will be unlocked each time you clear a stage.
You can earn rewards for first-time completion of stages.
In addition to clearing stage missions, several challenges have also been prepared inside the Palace.

<color=#FFD145>Exploration Record</color>
By completing mission goals before the event ends, you can earn mission rewards and Destiny Badges.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for exclusive rewards at the Gallery Auction.
After the event ends, unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
The badge rewards in the Exploration Log will also be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Museum Arc and Bank Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
When you defeat bosses, you will unlock higher level Sinner of Distortion challenges in order.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Level</color>
Each Sinner of Distortion has multiple distortion levels.
Each time you eliminate a boss, a new level is unlocked, and you receive a challenge score corresponding to the current distortion level.
A higher distortion level means more powerful bosses and a higher challenge score upon victory.
If you clear a difficulty level for the first time in challenge mode you will unlock that difficulty in stamina mode.
Taking on a challenge in stamina mode will expend stamina, but grants rewards for clearing it.
In stamina mode, you will be granted strong traits in order to support you in the boss challenge.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Record</color>
You will receive Destiny Badges for challenge goals cleared before the end of the event period.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for rewards at the Gallery Auction.
Title: Sinners of Vanity and Gluttony

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Action Rewards</color>
You will receive goal rewards and Destiny Badges for action goals cleared before the end of the event period.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for rewards at the Gallery Auction.
After the event ends, unobtained rewards will be sent to your mail, and unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Missions

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
• Log in to the game every day to receive that day's rewards.


<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
• Rewards will be unlocked sequentially based on the total number of login days. The day's rewards reset at 8 PM UTC.
Title: Daily Login

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About Unlocking Plans</color>
When you have cleared all missions in Lufel's "Business" Plans I and II, you will unlock Plans III and IV.
As with Plans I and II, Plans III and IV have 7 steps each.

<color=#FFD145>Mission Rewards</color>
After you complete a mission, you can receive its rewards.
You can also receive special rewards once you complete a certain number of missions.
If you complete all of the missions in Plan III, you can obtain one 5★ Phantom Thief's Cognitite of your choosing.
If you complete all of the missions in Plan IV, you can obtain one 5★ weapon of your choosing.
Title: About Lufel's "Business" Plan

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Station Shop</color>
You can buy <color=#FF423F>Lost Items</color> or <color=#FF423F>Charms</color> from Marthym.
You can also <color=#FF423F>enhance</color> Charms at certain stations.
Buying and enhancing requires Railway Coins, which you can obtain by <color=#FF423F>defeating enemies</color> or <color=#FF423F>destroying breakable objects</color>.
Title: Buying & Enhancing

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Backpack</color>
You can view obtained Charms and lost items from the backpack.

<color=#FFD145>Charms</color>
You can obtain a <color=#FF423F>Charm</color> when you defeat foes on battle platforms.
Collecting Charms from the same set will allow you to activate an additional <color=#FF423F>set effect</color>.
Collecting duplicates of the same Charm will increase the <color=#FF423F>rank</color> of that Charm.
You can use Railway Coins to expand the limit of Charms you can hold.
You can also sell Charms you obtain for additional Railway Coins.

<color=#FFD145>Lost Items</color>
You can select one random <color=#FF423F>Lost Item</color> at the start.
You can obtain additional <color=#FF423F>Lost Items</color> when you defeat <color=#FF423F>Shadows</color> and from <color=#FF423F>Special Events</color>.
Lost items can activate various special effects.
Title: Backpack

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Battle Platforms</color>
At battle platforms, you cannot pass until you defeat the Shadows that block your way.

<color=#FFD145>Insta-kill Levels</color>
You can progress quickly by insta-killing Wandering Shadows and Agitated Shadows.
 To insta-kill, the party's level must be higher than the enemy's level.
You can also reduce level required for an insta-kill with<color=#FF423F>train upgrades</color>.

<color=#FFD145>Battle Rules</color>
Even if you fail a battle, you can return to the platform and attempt the challenge again.
All KO'd Phantom Thieves will automatically revive with 25% of their max HP.
You can fully restore all allies' HP by using a <color=#FF423F>Prayer Magatama</color> from the <color=#FF423F>Party Area</color> on the main screen.
Title: Battle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
During the event period, when you complete a part-time job,
you will earn extra money. Effective up to 5 times per day.

<color=#FFD145>MaraThon Energy Supplies</color>
During the event, you can obtain 1 MaraThon Energy
from the Double Cash event screen
when you log in to the game.

<color=#FFD145>Other Explanations</color>
Social stat experience gained from part-time work is excluded from extra reward bonuses.
Part-time cash bonus from reading is included in the extra reward bonus calculation. <color=#FF423F>Part-time cash bonus gained from Chihaya Mifune is not included in the calculation</color>.
Title: About Wage Up

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
In training evaluation, you can check the training status and evaluation of your teammates in real time.
When checking the evaluation of other players, there is a slight delay in data updates.

<color=#FFD145>Stat Training Goals Explanation</color>
This system displays recommended training stats and their target values for all teammates.
It displays training progress by comparing current stat values to goals.
Total Mult. + refers to the sum of stat values with Mult. + in their names.

<color=#FFD145>Evaluation Explanation</color>
The training evaluation of the teammate is influenced by the following factors:
1. The rarity of the Phantom Thief
2. The training goal progress of the Phantom Thief.
3. The training progress of the Phantom Thief's stats.
Additionally, the system ranks the training of the Phantom Thief based on the evaluation.
Title: Training Evaluation

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Shadow of Lust: Cupid and Shadow of Vanity: Aegipan have been unleashed in Shadows of Lust and Vanity, a limited-time, high-difficulty challenge event.
There are various timed deadlines to watch out for, so please be careful.
When you challenge Shadows of Lust and Vanity, you can obtain Joy Hectomedals
 and exchange them for rare items in the Station of Fate.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Levels</color>
Each time you defeat an enemy, a new distortion level is unlocked.
When the level increases, the enemy's difficulty and actions will grow stronger.

<color=#FFD145>Ranking Rewards</color>
After defeating an enemy, a ranking will be set according to the difficulty of the challenge and amount of turns your allies took in combat.
Taking fewer turns and clearing higher difficulties will increase your rank.
When each challenge ends, the ranking will be confirmed.
Unfinished battle records will not be included in the ranking, so be sure to finish challenges before the end period

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Goals</color>
Complete the goals set for each challenge before the event ends to earn rewards.
Unclaimed challenge rewards will be sent to your Mail screen after the event ends.
Title: Shadows of Lust and Vanity

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, you can obtain Gold Tickets and Meta Jewels for inviting new and returning players.

<color=#FFD145>Recruiting Mission</color>
During the event period, you can receive rewards when you invite players who meet the required conditions and link with your invite code.
When linked friends complete missions, the inviter also gets rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Recruited Players</color>
Recruited Players consist of new players, as well as players who have not logged in for 14 consecutive days or more.
During the event, recruited players can only be linked with one invite code.
Title: Recruit a Friend

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event period, new players and players who have not logged in for 14 days or more will be enrolled in the Call to Adventure event.
During the event, you can obtain rewards for completing Recruiting Missions.
You can move to the event screen by tapping the Recruit a Friend button.
Share your personal invite code
and invite other players to participate in the event if they meet the eligibility conditions.

<color=#FFD145>Invite Code Linking</color>
You can link a friend's invite code from Bind a Code.
Once an invite code is linked, you can begin receiving rewards.
You can only link one invite code during the event.
Title: Call to Adventure

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
The event goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Shadows of Ruin, and Kichijoji Adventure. When you achieve individual event goals, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels and the event currency, Plum Blossom Knots.
After the event concludes, each Plum Blossom Knot
will be converted to 100 Konpaku Gems.

<color=#FFD145>Sweet Yet Sour</color>When you collect Plum Blossom Knots, you can exchange them for Riko's exclusive 4★ weapon, Red Plum Blossom, and its required forging materials, Red Plum Blossom Shards.

<color=#FFD145>7-Day Login Bonus</color>
In the Gift from the Disciplinary Committee Chair event, you will receive login bonuses every day you log in, for a maximum of 7 days.
Rewards will be unlocked sequentially according to your cumulative login days, and rewards for the day will refresh at 8 PM UTC.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 1

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
The event goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Shadows of Ruin, and Kichijoji Adventure.
When you achieve individual event goals, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels and the event currency, Plum Blossom Arm Bands.

<color=#FFD145>Quick Unlock</color>
Even if you have not met the conditions for unlocking goals, you can still enter the event area and complete goals.
Even after the event ends, the event areas will remain unlocked.
Main Story Chapter 3 and the corresponding Palace Exploration location do not support Quick Unlocking.
Please continue the Main Story and complete goals.
The Quick Unlock function can only be used after completing goals related to Traces of Dreams and Velvet Room Fusion.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 1 Goals

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
Once you collect the required amount of Plum Blossom Knots, you can exchange them for either Riko's 4★ specialty weapon, Red Plum Blossom, or for Red Plum Blossom Shards, which are required for weapon forging.
Exchange rewards will not consume Plum Blossom Knots.
Title: About Sweet Yet Sour

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
New Promises introduces accomplice teaser events.
During the event, you will be able to unlock new accomplices.
You can still unlock the new accomplices through missions even after the event ends, but you won't be able to claim meeting rewards from the event.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
You can claim meeting rewards from the event screen when you unlock certain accomplices.
Title: New Promises

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, you can participate in a drawing by using Kagura Bells to Pray.
You can obtain Kagura Bells when you purchase Daily Prayer Lucky Bags.
You can also obtain Kagura Bells when you complete Requests.
During the event period, you can earn additional Kagura Bells
when you participate in Unconditional Love Phase 1
You can earn even more Kagura Bells when you participate in Marthym's Appreciation Event.

<color=#FFD145>Prayer Gacha</color>
There are multiple gachas included in the Prayer Gacha,
each with their own Grand Prize.
When you obtain the grand prize from the current gacha, you can then unlock the next gacha.
You can also continue to pull from the current gacha without unlocking the next gacha.
Pulling all items in the current gacha
will automatically unlock the next gacha.
Title: About Praying at Marthym's Shop

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, Memories related to specific characters will be unlocked for a limited time.
Enjoy a wonderful time together with your cherished friends by the sea.
 You can receive rewards when you complete a memory story.
 Completing all memory stories for a character will unlock new beach talks for that character and will also allow you to invite them to watch fireworks with you at the fireworks festival.
