During the event, you can view your Summer Memories with characters as many times as you would like.
Title: Summer Memories

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
You can obtain rewards when you <color=#FF423F>dispatch Thieves</color> on <color=#FF423F>tasks</color> according to each task's requirements.
You can get additional rewards by meeting <color=#FF423F>bonus</color> conditions.

<color=#FFD145>Types of Tasks</color>
<color=#FF423F>Limited</color>: These tasks appear when certain conditions are met.
<color=#FF423F>Weekly/Daily</color>: These tasks are refreshed once within their respective periods.
<color=#FF423F>Regular</color>:These tasks are refreshed automatically upon completion.
<color=#FFD145>Rerolling Tasks</color>
You can reroll unclaimed <color=#FF423F>non-limited</color> tasks once.
<color=#FF423F>The first reroll each day is free</color>.
Regular tasks require Task Refresh Tickets to reroll.
Limit for rerolling tasks per day: %s.

<color=#FFD145>Task Level</color>
Completing tasks will accumulate task experience points.
When your level increases, the number of tasks you can claim simultaneously will increase, as well as the amount of regular tasks that <color=#FF423F>appear at once</color>.
Title: Dispatch Tasks

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
The Fireworks Experience event allows you to make your own fireworks. Launch your finished fireworks at Shirosato Kaigan.
Select your favorite shapes and colors, create your fireworks, and launch them at the fireworks launch point.
When you launch fireworks, you can invite friends to enjoy the experience together.
Making fireworks will consume a certain amount of Shakudama. You can create up to 20 fireworks at one time.
Shakudama can be obtained either from a set daily amount in Today's Supplies gained during firework festivals, or from participating in the event Summer! Swimsuits! Sea Time!

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
The Fireworks Experience event contains Experience Goals, which can grant rewards and unlock new firework types when completed.
Title: Fireworks Festival

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Firework Launch Rules</color>
You can invite friends that are unlocked and enjoy the fireworks together.
Once you complete a friend's memory story in the Summer Memories event, you can invite them to watch the fireworks with you.
When setting your personal firework launch plan, you can select the fireworks you want to launch and the order in which they will launch.
When you launch the fireworks, you will earn a set amount of launch rewards corresponding to the amount of fireworks that were used.
If you skip during the launch, the fireworks scene will skip and you will immediately obtain launch rewards.
Title: Arrange Fireworks

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, run the shaved ice shop and aim for the highest sales.
There are three levels of scores for sales, and you will receive a satisfaction score when serving customers. Serve as many customers as possible in a short about of time, increase your sales, and earn high customer satisfaction.
Your friends will also visit the shaved ice shop after working hours.
Title: Shaved Ice Shuffle

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Shooting Challenge</color>
Make use of your friend's support to knock down lots of targets and get a high score.
Each stage has 3 challenge goals, and completing them grants rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Summer Memories</color>
Hang out with your friends and receive rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Strange Changes on the Beach: Fun in the Sun</color>
During the event, unlock limited-time stages and collect materials.
<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
Completing goals for Water Gun Fight and Strange Changes on the Beach: Fun in the Sun will grant rewards including Rare Shells.
You can use Rare Shells to exchange for rewards in the shop.
Title: Summer Party Part 1

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Shaved Ice Shuffle</color>
Serve as many customers as possible in the time limit while earning high sales and satisfaction scores. Your friends will come visit after hours, so be sure to serve up the shaved ice they've been craving.
There are three levels for both sales goals and customer satisfaction. Achieving these goals will grant you rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Summer Memories</color>
Earn rewards for spending time with your friends.

<color=#FFD145>Strange Changes on the Beach: Shaved Ice Fest</color>
 During the event, limited time stages will be unlocked where you can collect materials.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
During the event period, you can earn goal rewards, including Rainbow Umbrellas when you achieve goals in Shaved Ice Shuffle and Strange Changes on the Beach: Shaved Ice Fest.
Rainbow Umbrellas can be exchanged for shop rewards.
Title: Summer Party Part 2

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Basic Rules</color>
Thief Tryouts are updated regularly, unlocking new chapters each time.
The chapter is divided into two parts, Challenge and Limited Time.
Challenge is permanent, and rewards can only be obtained on first clearing.
Limited Time will unlock only for the specified time, and rewards can be obtained multiple times.

<color=#FFD145>Unlocking Limited Time</color>
After each update, new chapters will unlock for a limited period of time.
During the limited time unlock period, Limited Time will be unlocked in the chapter.
In Limited Time, the amount of challenge attempts is limited per day, and all Limited Time stages share this challenge attempt limit.

<color=#FFD145>Unlock Rules</color>
During the limited time unlock, clearing first the boss challenge stage in Challenge will unlock the corresponding Thief Tryout Chapter.
Previous challenge completion statuses will not be reset.
Title: Thief Tryout

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Stage Unlock</color>
During the event, new stage challenges will be unlocked every day.
When you clear a challenge, you will receive rating medals. When you clear a rank goal, you will unlock the next challenge difficulty.

<color=#FFD145>Stage Rating</color>
Eliminating targets in stages will accumulate stage score. At the end of the challenge, this attempt's score will be exchanged for rating medals.
Bronze Shooter: 500.
Silver Shooter: 500-1000.
Gold Silver Shooter: 1000-3000.
Platinum Shooter: 3000 or higher.

<color=#FFD145>Support Friends</color>
As levels are unlocked, more friends can join the Shooting Challenge to support you and cheer you on during the challenge.
Friends can active different support skills, and when you invite a friend to participate in the challenge with you, the support skill level is increased, reducing the cooldown on skills.

<color=#FFD145>Stage Goals</color>
Individual stages have 3 goal conditions, and you can obtain rewards when you achieve challenge goals.
Stage goal completion has no effect on the final rating level.
Title: Shooting Challenge

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Modify Weapon Cognition is a limited-time exchange event. This event is geared for players who accidentally spent the protagonist-only weapons Sennight Inferno or All In in the past.
This event is not permanent, so please be mindful of the exchange period.

<color=#FFD145>Exchange Rules</color>
You can spend certain quality weapons to trade for Sennight Inferno or All In. Several restrictions apply on the weapons you can exchange:
Equipped weapons can't be used.
Special protagonist-exclusive weapons can't be used.
Already forged weapons can't be used.
Locked weapons must be unlocked before they can be exchanged.
Title: Modify Weapon Cognition

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
The event goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Shadows of Ruin, and Kichijoji Adventure. When you achieve individual event goals, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels and the event currency, Plum Blossom Knots.
After the event concludes, each Plum Blossom Knot
will be converted to 100 Konpaku Gems.

<color=#FFD145>Sweet Yet Sour</color>When you collect Plum Blossom Knots, you can exchange them for Riko's exclusive 4★ weapon, Red Plum Blossom, and its required forging materials, Red Plum Blossom Shards.

<color=#FFD145>7 Day Login Bonus</color>
In the Gift from the Disciplinary Committee Chair event, you will receive login bonuses every day you log in, for a maximum of 7 days.
Rewards will be unlocked sequentially according to your cumulative login days, and rewards for the day will refresh at 8 PM UTC.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 2

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
The event goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Shadows of Ruin, and Kichijoji Adventure.
When you achieve individual event goals, you can obtain rewards like Meta Jewels and the event currency, Plum Blossom Arm Bands.

<color=#FFD145>Quick Unlock</color>
Even if you have not met the conditions for unlocking goals, you can still enter the event area and complete goals. Even after the event ends, the event areas will remain unlocked. Main Story Chapter 3 and the corresponding Palace Exploration do not support Quick Unlocking. Please continue the Main Story and complete goals.
The Quick Unlock function can only be used after completing goals related to Traces of Dreams and Velvet Room Fusion.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 2 Goals

strContent:
Collecting plum blossom arm bands will allow you to obtain the Persona Cu Chulainn and its seal.
Exchange rewards will not consume plum blossom arm bands.
Title: About Sweet Yet Sour

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
During the event, new boss challenges will be unlocked every week.

<color=#FFD145>Battle Effects</color>
When battle effects are added, they will increase the strength of the boss.
Battle effects are divided into three difficulties: stable, distressed, and berserk. You can only choose one difficulty level for the same type of battle effect each time.
Each effect has an abnormality level. After a boss is defeated, this selected abnormality level will be recorded, and you will receive the corresponding goal rewards based on your high score.

<color=#FFD145>Trial Mode</color>
There are two trial modes: fixed difficulty and custom difficulty.
Fixed difficulty has multiple challenges. As you complete each challenge, you can unlock its corresponding battle effects in custom difficulty.
In custom difficulty, you can choose which battle effects are applied. The more effects that are selected, the higher the abnormality level becomes.

<color=#FFD145>Difficulty Levels</color>
When you start a trial challenge, you can select how difficult the battle will be. The boss's level will increase as the battle's difficulty level increases.
New battle effects unlocked from clearing fixed-difficulty challenges can only be used in custom-difficulty battles of the same difficulty.
If you complete a fixed-difficulty challenge on the highest difficulty, you can use all newly unlocked battle effects in custom difficult at any difficulty level.
Title: Trial of Thorns

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Music Player</color>
Choose the music you listen to when wandering the city. By creating your own playlist, you can select what tracks will play depending on the time of day and weather.
Some songs have unlock conditions, and you can play them continuously from the music player after unlocking.

<color=#FFD145>Playlist</color>
You can set a playlist that matches the weather and time of day.
When customizing, you can select anywhere from one to five songs.
Selectable Weather: Clear and Rain.
Selectable Times: After School, Evening, and Night.

<color=#FFD145>Playable Areas</color>
The playlist can only be used in daily life sections.
It can't be used while progressing through the main story or in Metaverse areas.
Title: Music Player

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
The Cycle of Fate will be available for 2 weeks. During the event, you can clear event-exclusive missions from the View Missions area to get Oracle Ink.
Oracle Ink can be used to create Revelation Cards, as well as customize sets, marks, main attributes, and sub-attributes for Revelation Cards.
During the event, you can only customize 2 Revelation Cards.
Title: Cycle of Fate

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Event</color>
There are four sub-events
included in the event:
Pyramid Arc, Sinner of Wrath, Action Report,
and Open Source Code.
<color=#FFD145>Event Duration</color>Part 2 of Crossroads of Fate limited event.
On the last day, all events will close, with the exception of the Pyramid Arc,
and all unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Be sure to exchange them for rewards as soon as possible.
At the conclusion of the event, the Pyramid Arc will become a permanent event, and you will be able to continue exploring these stages.

<color=#FFD145>Pyramid Arc</color>
Explore the Pyramid with the Phantom Thieves of Hearts.

<color=#FFD145>Sinner of Wrath</color>
Challenge powerful bosses and gain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Action Report</color>
Achieve event goals and obtain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Open Source Code</color>
 Use Destiny Badges obtained through action reports
to trade for rewards in Open Source Code.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Pyramid Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Crossroads of Fate: Pyramid Arc is the third chapter of the Persona 5 special event.

<color=#FFD145>Palace Exploration</color>
During the event period, new stages will be unlocked every week. To challenge new stages, you must first clear the prerequisite stages.
You can earn rewards for first-time completion of stages.
Several challenges have also been prepared inside the Palaces.

<color=#FFD145>Reward</color>
By completing mission goals before the event ends, you can earn mission rewards and Destiny Badges.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for exclusive rewards at the Gallery Auction.
After the event ends, unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems. The badge rewards in the Exploration Log will also be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Pyramid Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
When you defeat bosses, you will unlock their corresponding Sinner of Distortion challenges.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Level</color>
Each Sinner of Distortion has multiple distortion levels.
When you eliminate a boss, a new level is unlocked, and you will receive a challenge score corresponding to the current distortion level.

A higher distortion level means more powerful bosses and a higher challenge score upon victory.
You can switch between challenge mode and stamina mode.
Clearing a difficulty level for the first time on challenge mode will unlock the difficulty on stamina mode.
Challenging on stamina mode will expend stamina, but grants rewards for clearing.

In stamina mode, you will be granted strong traits in order to support you in the boss challenge.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Record</color>
You will receive Destiny Badges: Wrath for challenge goals cleared before the end of the event period.

Destiny Badges: Wrath can be exchanged for rewards at Open Source Code.
Title: Sinner of Wrath

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Action Rewards</color>
You will receive goal rewards and Destiny Badges for action goals cleared before the end of the event period.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for rewards at the Gallery Auction.
After the event ends, unobtained rewards will be sent to your mail, and unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Action Report

Title: NB[St][239]

strContent:
Log in to the game every day to receive daily rewards.
Rewards will be unlocked sequentially based on the total number of login days. Daily rewards reset at 8 PM UTC.
Title: Anniversary Preparation

strContent:
During the event, you can obtain Celebratory Poppers when you complete Celebration Missions.
Using Celebratory Poppers and participating in the Half-Year Anniversary festival
will increase individual enthusiasm and server-wide enthusiasm levels.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
When you surpass a certain level of individual enthusiasm, you can obtain individual rewards.
Celebratory Poppers increase enthusiasm levels for the whole server.
When certain enthusiasm levels are reached, enthusiasm level rewards can be obtained.
Title: Half-Year Anniversary

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, you can open your personalized
Half-Year Anniversary memories.
After you're done viewing your commemorative album, you can share your Half-Year Anniversary memories.

<color=#FFD145>Event Rewards</color>
During the event, you can obtain event rewards when you watch and share your commemorative album.
Title: Commemorative Booklet

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, you can participate in the Celebration Feedback Event by making any purchase at Marthym's shop.
When you reach a specified amount, you can receive feedback rewards.
After the event ends, your purchase progress will be reset, so please be mindful of the event ending period.
Title: Celebration Gifts

strContent:
During the celebration, new celebration-exclusive items have been added to the shop for a limited time.
During the event period, you can purchase half-anniversary specialty items from Marthym, each of which can only be purchased once.
Title: Celebration Shop

strContent:
Tycoon is a 4-player card game.
To win the game, you must get rid of all your cards before the other players.

<color=#FFD145>Arena Mode</color>
In Classic, you can play against a CPU with a customizable difficulty and choose to play either 1 or 3 games for each match.
 In Ranked Match, play against other players, with every match consisting of three games.
Title: Tycoon

strContent:
Ranked Matches are multiplayer battles consisting of 3 rounds.
According to the final 1/2/3/4 overall ranking, you will obtain 40/25/10/5 Tycoon Points, respectively.
In Ranked Match and Classic, you can collect up to a maximum of 1000 Tycoon Points each week.

<color=#FFD145>Rules on Ranking Up</color>
Before the Tycoon rank, if you lose all ★ in your current rank, rank protection will activate and you will not lose any more ★.
For the Millionaire rank and above, if your overall ranking is 1/2/3/4, you will obtain +2/+1/+0/-1 ★, respectively.
Legendary Tycoons will not lose their rank even if they lose ★.
If players are tied with the same score, the tied players will get the higher ranking.

<color=#FFD145>Rank Rules</color>
There are 15 ranks in total, and 14 ranks have a maximum number of stars ranging from 2 to 4★.
When the amount of ★ exceeds the maximum value of the current rank, you will be promoted.
Conversely, if the number of stars becomes less that zero, you will be demoted.
The final rank is Legendary Tycoon, where the ranking is directly displayed instead of the number of ★.

<color=#FFD145>Rankings</color>
Rankings will be based upon individual player ranks, where higher ranked players will be placer higher in the rankings.
In the Legendary Tycoon ranking, a score is calculated based on the overall ranking of each game.
If the overall ranking of each game is 1/2/3/4, you will receive +2/+1/-1/-2 ★, and you will be ranked based on this score.

<color=#FFD145>Preparation Stage After Successful Matching</color>
After successful matching, you will enter the preparation stage where you can change your character.
In Ranked Matches, your preferred character will be selected first.
If multiple players select the same character, one player will be randomly selected to use the initial character, and the other players will need to switch to another character.
If you cannot select a character during the preparation stage, a random character will be selected after 30 seconds.

<color=#FFD145>Season Calculation</color>
Tycoon has one season every 6 weeks, and at the end of the season, rewards will be distributed by mail based on the final rank.
At the end of the season, you will be demoted based on your current rank.
In the 1-2 <color=#FF423F>Beggar category</color>, you will not be demoted.
In the 3-6 <color=#FF423F>Poor category</color>, you will be demoted to 3-Lower Poor 0★.
In the 7-10 <color=#FF423F>Commoner category</color>, you will be demoted to 5-<color=#FF423F>Upper Poor 0★</color>.
In the 11-14 <color=#FF423F>Rich Category</color>, you will be demoted to 7-Novice Commoner 0★.
In the 15 <color=#FF423F>Tycoon Category</color>, you will be demoted to 9-Upper Commoner 0★.
Title: Ranked Match

strContent:
Classic matches are CPU battles consisting of either 1 or 3 rounds, where you can select the difficulty level.
Three characters will be selected at random from your already-unlocked characters, and the game will start.

<color=#FFD145>Game Rewards</color>
In Ranked Match and Classic
you can collect up to a maximum of 1000 Tycoon Points each week.
Corresponding to the final 1/2/3/4 overall ranking, you can receive 16/10/4/2 Tycoon Points in 1 round.
If you play 3 rounds, you can receive 40/25/10/5 Tycoon Points, respectively.
Title: Classic

strContent:
Choose the character you will use to participate in Tycoon.
In Ranked Matches, your preferred character will be selected first.
If multiple players select the same character, one player will be randomly selected to use the initial character, and the other players will need to switch to another character.
You can spend Tycoon Points at Paradise Mall's Tycoon Counter to obtain <color=#FF423F>Exclusive Invitations</color>
and unlock Tycoon characters.
Title: Character Selection

strContent:
Obtain Tycoon Points by completing Weekly, Seasonal, and Career challenges.
Weekly challenges are refreshed every Sunday at 8 PM UTC and last for 1 week.
Seasonal challenges are refreshed at the beginning of a season and last for the duration of the season.
Career challenges do not refresh, but the challenge content is updated each season.
Title: Challenge List

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Card Collections</color>
You can view all card collections here.
Certain cards can have custom skins added.

<color=#FFD145>Custom Cards</color>
If you have a custom card, you can change its skin.
In Ranked Matches, only your cards will have this skin in effect.
In Classic Matches, if any character has a customer card in their hand, all skins will be activated.
Title: Card Skin

strContent:
During the event, when you participate in ranked or classic matches, you can obtain Tycoon Medals.
By collecting Tycoon Medals you can obtain awards from the event area.
There is a limit on the amount of Tycoon Medals you can obtain.
On the second and third days of the event, the acquisition limit of 600 Tycoon Medals will be lifted.
Title: Super Tycoon

strContent:
Thief Tryout mode and Character Trial mode will be unlocked.
During the event, you can beat limited-time stages, obtain Trial Tickets, and exchange them for rewards in the trial shop.
In Character Trial challenges, you can try working with new allies in designated challenge stages.
Note that you can only use fixed teams; team configurations and training evaluations cannot be adjusted.
You can obtain rewards from the event screen after you clear a Character Trial for the first time.
Title: Character Trial

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>About the Events</color>
There are four sub-events included in the event: Spaceport Arc, Sinner of Greed, Action Report, and Secret Garden.

<color=#FFD145>Event Duration</color>
Part 4 of Crossroads of Fate, the Spaceport Arc, is a limited-time event.
Once the event period has ended, all events will close (excluding Spaceport Arc), and all unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems.
Be sure to trade your Destiny Badges for rewards before the events end.
Once the events end, the Spaceport Arc will become a permanent event, and you will be able to continue exploring any of its stages that you haven't completed.

<color=#FFD145>Spaceport Arc</color>
Explore the Spaceport with the Phantom Thieves of Hearts.

<color=#FFD145>Sinner of Greed</color>
Challenge powerful bosses and gain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Action Report</color>
Achieve event goals and obtain rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Secret Garden</color>
Use Destiny Badges obtained through action reports to trade for rewards in the Secret Garden.
Title: Crossroads of Fate: Spaceport Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
Crossroads of Fate: Spaceport Arc is the fourth chapter of the Persona 5 special event.

<color=#FFD145>Palace Exploration</color>
During the event period, new stages will be unlocked every week.
To challenge new stages, you must first clear the prerequisite stages.
You can earn rewards for first-time completion of stages.
In addition to clearing stage missions, several challenges have also been prepared inside the Palace.

<color=#FFD145>Exploration Record</color>
By completing mission goals before the event ends, you can earn goal rewards and Destiny Badges.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for exclusive rewards at the Secret Garden.
After the event ends, unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems.The badge rewards in the Exploration Log will also be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Spaceport Arc

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Overview</color>
When you defeat bosses, you will unlock their corresponding Sinner of Distortion challenges.

<color=#FFD145>Distortion Level</color>
Each Sinner of Distortion has multiple distortion levels.
When you eliminate a boss, a new level is unlocked, and you will receive a challenge score corresponding to the current distortion level.
A higher distortion level means more powerful bosses and systems, but also a higher challenge score upon victory.
You can switch between challenge mode and stamina mode.
Clearing a difficulty level for the first time on challenge mode will unlock the difficulty on stamina mode.
Challenging on stamina mode will expend stamina, but grants rewards for clearing.
In stamina mode, you will be granted strong traits in order to support you in the boss challenge.

<color=#FFD145>Challenge Record</color>
You will receive Destiny Badges: Greed for challenge goals cleared before the end of the event period.
Destiny Badges: Greed can be exchanged for rewards at the Secret Garden.
Title: Sinner of Greed

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Action Rewards</color>
You will receive goal rewards and Destiny Badges for action goals cleared before the end of the event period.
Destiny Badges can be exchanged for rewards at the Secret Garden.
After the event ends, unobtained rewards will be sent to your mail, and unused Destiny Badges will be converted into Konpaku Gems, so please be mindful of the event end time.
Title: Action Report

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Action Rewards</color>
When you train the Mindscape of an ally, you can strengthen their skills and stats in battle and activate Mindscape skills.

<color=#FFD145>Stat Strengthening</color>
This improves your ally's base stat.
Materials Required: Stardust Shards.

<color=#FFD145>Core Attribute Strengthening</color>
This greatly improves your ally's base stat.
Materials Required: Stardust Bells.

<color=#FFD145>Rank Strengthening</color>
By strengthening attribute ranks, you can strengthen the effects of your ally' corresponding attributes.
Materials Required: Stardust Bottles and Venus Bottles.

<color=#FFD145>Skill Strengthening</color>
This improves the skill effects of your ally's Persona skills.
Materials Required: Stardust Gems and Venus Gems.
Title: Mindscape

strContent:
Becomes playable once the protagonist reaches level 32 and clears the mission Metro of Desire.
Clearing objectives during the event period grants Dispatch Experience.
Title: Metro of Desire

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Visitors</color>
Visitors can come to visit your Thieves Den.
After a visit, you and your visitors will gain Visitor EXP, which can be collected from Manage Visitors.
By receiving Visitor EXP, you can boost your visit level with that visitor.
When your Visitor Level with a visitor reaches a certain point, you can obtain P Medals, and even unlock special conversations with them.

<color=#FFD145>Special Events</color>
When visitors continuously come to your Thieves Den,you will have a chance to trigger special dialog events that are unlocked daily.
The first time you trigger an event, you will gain extra Visitor EXP.

<color=#FFD145>Unspecified Visitors</color>
There may be times when visitors not specified in Manage Visitors come to your Thieves Den.
Title: Visit from Friends

strContent:
The event goals are separated into 4 parts:
Main Story, Metaverse Exploration, Shadows of Ruin, and Thieves Den Remodeling.
When you complete each objective, you will earn Meta Jewels and the event currency Plum Blossom Dango.
Title: About Unconditional Love: Phase 3

strContent:
Collecting Plum Blossom Dango will allow you to obtain the Persona Black Frost and its seal.
You won't need to spend Plum Blossom Dango for exchange rewards.
Title: About Sweet Yet Sour

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Return Conditions</color>
1. The protagonist is at or above level 15 and has cleared up to Traces of Dreams: Return to Shibuya in the main quest.
2. You haven't logged in for 8 or more consecutive days, and the return login reward letter is active.
3. You haven't logged in for 15 or more consecutive days, and the return login reward letter or return event Welcome Back Bonus is ongoing. 
4. 30 days or more have passed since your last return login reward letter was active.
Title: Return Conditions

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the Welcome Back Program event period, missions will unlock every day.
You can obtain rewards by completing these missions while the event is ongoing.
If you complete a certain amount of missions, you can obtain even more rewards.

<color=#FFD145>Bonus</color>
You can receive additional rewards when you complete misions if you purchase Bonus.
Title: Welcome Back Program

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Event Rules</color>
During the event, Marthym's Pop-up store will be available to sell limited time items.
Items have a purchase limit, and individual packages can only be purchased once.
Title: Marthym's Pop-Up Shop

strContent:
During the trial, you must challenge Monitoring Points in the astrolabe one at a time.
During the battle, multiple parties will attempt the challenge, and the battle will continue until victory.
Every challenge attempt will consume Spiritual Endurance.
Allies can only be used a limited number of times.

<color=#FFD145>Monitoring Points: Types</color>
Monitoring Points are divided into multiple types depending on the battle difficulty and rewards.
Guardian Star: Stardust Shards, Stardust Bottles, Stardust Gems, Palace Star: Stardust Bottles, Stardust Gems, Venus Gems, Life Star: Stardust Bottles, Stardust Gems, Venus Gems - Various

<color=#FFD145>Monitoring Points: Battles</color>
Monitoring Points have various Ambiences that can have buff and debuff effects on your teammates.
Choosing the most suitable Phantom Thief to participate based on ambience will yield effective results.
Enemy levels and abilities will increase as you continue, but trial rewards will also improve.

<color=#FFD145>Monitoring Points: Reset</color>
Monitoring Points with challenge records can be reset.
Resetting will abandon all challenge progress, but your consumed Spiritual Endurance and challenge attempts will also be restored.
Monitoring points you have already received rewards from must be reoccupied before you can receive rewards from new challenges.

<color=#FFD145>Reset Periods</color>
Every week, Spiritual Endurance and teammate challenge attempts will be restored to full.
Trial Goals: Updated every period
Trial Badges: Updated every period
Title: Trial of the Astrolabe

strContent:
In the Thieves Den, you can use P Medals to purchase statues, music, and illustrations.
With these purchases, you will also get Thieves Den experience points.
P Medals are automatically generated as time passes, but must be manually claimed in order to be ready for use.
Once you reach the limit for unclaimed P Medals, more P Medals won't be generated until they are claimed.

<color=#FFD145>Den Level</color>
After you obtain a certain amount of Thieves Den experience points, your Den Level will automatically rise.
When this happens, your limit and generation speed for P Medals and Visitor EXP will increase, and you will unlock the ability to purchase certain items.

<color=#FFD145>Décor Benefits</color>
Statues and illustrations you've obtained will provide décor benefits, whether you have them displayed or not.
You can view these benefits under the Collection Effects category.
Title: Thieves Den

strContent:
<color=#FFD145>Purchasing Items</color>
You can buy statues using P Medals from Den Design.
The amount of statues you can buy will increase as your Den Level increases.
Some important statues can only be unlocked for purchase after completing certain main story points.

<color=#FFD145>Item Placement</color>
Already-purchased statues can also be placed using Den Design.
Statues can only be placed in squares of specific colors.
As your Den Level increases, the amount of grid spaces will also increase.
Title: AAAAAA==
